name: General Chemistry I
description: This course introduces students to the principles of chemistry. Students will learn about atomic structure and bonding, stoichiometry and chemical reactions, gases, thermochemistry, and quantum mechanics.

name: General Chemistry II
description: This course continues the study of the principles of chemistry. Students will learn about liquids and solids, solutions, acids and bases, chemical equilibrium, thermodynamics, kinetics, electrochemistry, and nuclear chemistry.

name: Organic Chemistry I
description: This course introduces students to the principles of organic chemistry. Students will learn about the structure and reactivity of organic molecules, including nomenclature, stereochemistry, and functional groups.

name: Physical Chemistry I
description: This course introduces students to the principles of physical chemistry. Students will learn about thermodynamics, kinetics, quantum mechanics, and spectroscopy.

name: Organic Chemistry II
description: This course continues the study of the principles of organic chemistry. Students will learn about mechanisms, reactions, synthesis, and spectroscopy.

name: Physical Chemistry II
description: This course continues the study of the principles of physical chemistry. Students will learn about statistical mechanics, thermodynamics, quantum mechanics, and spectroscopy.

name: Analytical Chemistry
description: This course introduces students to the principles of analytical chemistry. Students will learn about chemical analysis methods, including chromatography, spectroscopy, and electrochemistry.

name: Inorganic Chemistry
description: This course introduces students to the principles of inorganic chemistry. Students will learn about the electronic structure of atoms, chemical bonding in inorganic compounds, coordination chemistry, and solid state chemistry.

name: Advanced Organic Chemistry
description: This course provides an in-depth exploration of the principles of organic chemistry. Students will study advanced topics such as pericyclic reactions, organometallic chemistry, and natural product synthesis.
